basics.name: Kevin Wilson
basics.label: Developer
basics.summary: I’m a .NET Developer, JavaScript enthusiast, Android user, sometime musician and sometime cook originally from Kilmarnock, Scotland, but now settled in Glasgow.

work.summary: Senior developer working on a large-scale Agile greenfield project to create an intelligent system for facilities management.
highlights: AngularJS project built in TypeScript with a .NET back-end.
Use of BreezeJS for querying and diplaying of large data sets.

work.summary: Senior .NET developer, responsible for defining coding standards and architecture principles and mentoring of junior members of the team.
highlights: Development in ASP.NET 2.0-4.5 through Visual Studio 2005-2013 on top of MS SQL.
Lead development on RequireJS SPA build on top of Node.js.
Experience in JQuery, Google Maps API, LINQ, Entity Framework (including code first), WCF, Test Driven Development, Agile projects, Geolocation, Oracle data connections from .NET.
Experience of Provider and Presenter (Inversion of Control) architecture patterns implemented using Castle and LinFu.
Developed a micro-JS framework for use on a mobile web application.
Responsible for upkeep of HTML, CSS and accessibility standards.
Maintainer of continuous integration development environment.
Worked for four months in early 2012 and again in late 2013 on secondment to head office in Toronto as project technical lead within an Agile team following a Kanban development process.

work.summary: Part of the IT department maintaining the company website and developing new software solutions.
highlights: Web coding mainly in ASP.NET framework using VB.NET and C# on top of MySql database engine.
Development of .net web services.
Creation and maintenance of CSS to W3C specifications.
User interface design and building using AJAX components.
Designed and built XML-based marketing software application.
Rebuilt website in XHTML to comply with WC3 guidelines.

work.summary: Part of the web development team designing, building and maintaining a variety educational curriculum websites.
highlights: All software development within Learning and Teaching Scotland carried out under ISO 9001 quality standards.
Work included XHTML, CSS, ASP, ASP.NET, XML, Flash and Java and was built to meet accessibility guidelines.
Creation of XML based Flash applications written in ActionScript 2.0.

work.summary: Part time work during the course of my degree
highlights: Four years’ business/industrial experience as an Assistant Software Developer / Tester, running in parallel with my University degree.
Software testing role using formal test strategies on a variety of system/browser platforms.
